newsitem.title: USA: PC shipments in LatAm up 30 pct in '96 - Dataquest.
newsitem.headline: PC shipments in LatAm up 30 pct in '96 - Dataquest.

text.p: Shipments of personal computers in Latin America topped 3.1 million units last year, an increase of 30 percent over 1995, the Dataquest market research company said on Tuesday.
Dataquest said in a statement that the increase was led by strong personal computer growth in Mexico, Colombia, Argentina and Brazil.
Brazil led all countries in Latin America with 1.3 million units shipped in 1996. Mexico was the fastest-growing country with a 73 percent increase of shipments over 1995.

"This growth in Latin America is due to a regionwide understanding of the need to apply the latest technologies to drive economic development," said Luis Anavitarte, lead research analyst for Dataquest's Latin America Quarterly PC Statistics program.

Compaq Computer Corp finished as the No. 1 vendor in 1996 by growing 34 percent over 1995. International Business Machines Corp was second, while Acer Inc was the No. 3 vendor in the region, maintaining its leadership in the Mexican and Chilean markets.
